titleStmt.title: Isaac Wrenchey et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5544

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Your Petitioners would Respectfully represent to Your Excellency that at the last May term of the Fleming Circuit Court a fine of $25. was entered against William S. Flora for a very trival offence that of striking a Man when provoked to do so by very abusive epithets. Execution has now issued on said fine and Mr. F. being a very poor man & concequently, ill able to pay said fine. We would therefore respectfully petition Your Excellency to remit said fine. hoping you will comply with our request. we are very respectfully Your Excelleny's obident servents,

Isacc Wrenchey
Newton Anderson
S. H. Daily
Wm Grose
A. D. Miller
Edward Moren (Jr)

Fleming Cir Ct
vs
Wm L Flora
$25
